snippet: Yemeni officials said they had thwarted a plan to kidnap or kill foreigners working at an oil terminal, but the claim aroused skepticism among terrorism analysts.
abstract: Yemeni security officials say they foiled plot by Al Qaeda to seize an important port and kidnap or kill foreigners working there, but claim arouses some skepticism among Yemenis and independent terrorism analysts.

byline.original: By NASSER ARRABYEE and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Nasser Arrabyee reported from Sana, and Alan Cowell from London. Robert F. Worth contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Yemeni officials said they had thwarted a plan to kidnap or kill foreigners working at an oil terminal, but the claim aroused skepticism among terrorism analysts.

headline.main: Yemen, on Alert for Terrorism, Says It Foiled a Qaeda Plot
headline.print_headline: Yemen, on Alert for Terrorism, Claims It Foiled a Plot by Al Qaeda
